body:
### Problem

In vim and neovim, if using `yaw` or `yaW`
1. on the last word of a line, the yanked content contains an extra `space` before the word.
2. on other words of a line, the yanked content doesn't contain a prefix `space`

This seems like a bug instead of a feature.

Checked on issues or `:help WORD`, no records, but the `help` said other particular behaviour of the last word of the line.

### Steps to reproduce

# tested case
```
foo bar foo bar foo
```
1. `yaw` on the first `foo`, pasted a `foo`
2. `yaw` on the second `foo`, pasted a `foo`
3. `yaw` on the third `foo`, which is the last word of a line, pasted a ` foo`, which added a space before `foo`

### Expected behavior

`yaw` is yank a word
1. if with space, pls with space if there is a space with all words
2. if without space, pls without space on any words.

Just make them consistent if no particular usage. Also, after `yaw`, the cursor stayed at the space or the first char of the word in current vim/neovim.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-746+ge55e80d51

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

yes

### Operating system/version

Linux d 6.3.0-1-amd64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Debian 6.3.7-1 (2023-06-12) x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Terminal name/version

Xfce4 terminal

### $TERM environment variable

bash: xterm-256color: command not found

### Installation

github repo

labels.description: upstream issue that needs to be fixed in vim first
labels.name: needs:vim-patch

title: `aw` inconsistency at eol, with/without a space before
